title: 104_hr842
content: The "Truth in Budgeting Act" is the short title of this Act. It addresses the budgetary treatment of various trust funds related to highways, airports, inland waterways, and harbor maintenance. The "Truth in Budgeting Act" exempts the receipts and disbursements of certain trust funds from being counted as new budget authority, outlays, receipts, or deficit/surplus for budget purposes. It also exempts them from general budget limitations on expenditures and net lending. The "Truth in Budgeting Act" exempts certain trust funds from budgetary restrictions on interest payments, limiting the amount of interest that can be credited to specific funds to the average interest rate on 52-week Treasury securities sold to the public during the fiscal year. This amendment applies to fiscal years starting after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Safeguards against deficit spending from Airport and Airway Trust Fund. Section 47131 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to include safeguards against deficit spending. The Secretary must estimate unfunded aviation authorizations and net aviation receipts annually. If unfunded authorizations exceed receipts, certain procedures must be followed. The Secretary will determine any excess amount if subsection (a)(1) exceeds the amount in subsection (a)(2). If there is an excess in unfunded authorizations compared to receipts, the Secretary will calculate the percentage and adjust the authorizations from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund for the next fiscal year accordingly. The Secretary will adjust authorizations from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund for the next fiscal year based on any excess amount determined if subsection (a)(1) exceeds subsection (a)(2). If there is a reduction in authorized appropriations, they will be increased by an equal percentage to prevent exceeding the specified amounts. The Secretary will apportion available funds as necessary and report estimates and determinations to Congress. Definitions for "net aviation receipts" are provided for clarity. The curr_chunk discusses the receipts of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, unfunded aviation authorizations, and the excess amount authorized to be appropriated from the fund. The curr_chunk discusses the excess amount authorized to be appropriated from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund after all other obligations have been paid. SEC. 4. Safeguards against deficit spending out of the Inland Waterways Trust Fund and Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund. The Secretary of the Army, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, must estimate the unfunded inland waterways authorizations and net inland waterways receipts annually. If there is excess unfunded inland waterways authorizations, the Secretary will determine the amount of such excess. The Secretary of the Army, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, estimates unfunded inland waterways authorizations and receipts annually. If there is excess unfunded authorizations, the Secretary determines the percentage of the total authorized amounts to be appropriated from the Trust Fund for the next fiscal year, and reduces each amount accordingly. The Secretary of the Army, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, estimates unfunded inland waterways authorizations and receipts annually. If there is excess unfunded authorizations, the Secretary determines the percentage of the total authorized amounts to be appropriated from the Trust Fund for the next fiscal year, and reduces each amount accordingly. If the Secretary determines that the amount described in subsection (a)(1) does not exceed the amount described in subsection (a)(2) or that the excess referred to in subsection (b) with respect to the Trust Fund is less than the amount previously determined, each amount authorized to be appropriated that was reduced under subsection (c)(2) with respect to the Trust Fund shall be increased by an equal percentage. The Secretary of the Army reports estimates and determinations to Congress regarding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund, and Highway Trust Fund as defined in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 defines terms related to various trust funds, including the Inland Waterways Trust Fund, Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund, and Highway Trust Fund. The Inland Waterways Trust Fund is established by section 9506 and includes terms like net harbor maintenance receipts and net inland waterways receipts. Unfunded inland waterways authorizations refer to the excess of authorized appropriations at any given time. The term "unfunded harbor maintenance authorizations" refers to the excess of authorized appropriations from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund over the available amount in the fund at a given time. SEC. 5. APPLICABILITY. This Act applies to fiscal years starting after September 30, 1995. Passed the House of Representatives on April 17, 1996.
